algorithm_technique: Sort the asteroids by mass. Iterate through them, destroying each if the planet's mass is sufficient. Update planet's mass.
problem_summary_simple: Determine if a planet can destroy all asteroids by colliding with them in some order, gaining mass from destroyed asteroids.
problem_summary_technical: Sort asteroids by mass. Greedily destroy smaller asteroids first, accumulating mass. If at any point planet mass is less than asteroid mass, return false.
time_complexity: O(N log N) due to sorting, where N is the number of asteroids.
space_complexity: O(1) if sorting is done in-place, or O(N) if a copy is made for sorting.
key_insights: The optimal strategy is to destroy asteroids in increasing order of mass.
If the planet's mass is ever less than an asteroid's mass, it cannot be destroyed.
The planet's mass increases by the mass of each destroyed asteroid.
